train_snake.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python3
2 """Training script for the Snake game in ARC tutorials.
3 License:
4  BSD 3-Clause License
5  Copyright (c) 2023, Autonomous Robotics Club of Purdue (Purdue ARC)
6  All rights reserved.
7 """
8 
9 from rktl_autonomy import SnakeInterface
10 from stable_baselines3 import PPO
11 from stable_baselines3.common.vec_env import SubprocVecEnv
12 from stable_baselines3.common.env_util import make_vec_env
13 from stable_baselines3.common.logger import configure
14 from stable_baselines3.common.callbacks import CheckpointCallback
15 from os.path import expanduser
16 import uuid
17 
18 if __name__ == '__main__': # this is required due to forking processes
19  run_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) # ALL running environments must share this
20 
21  env = make_vec_env(SnakeInterface, env_kwargs={'run_id':run_id},
22  n_envs=16, vec_env_cls=SubprocVecEnv)
23  model = PPO("MlpPolicy", env)
24 
25  # log training progress as CSV
26  log_dir = expanduser(f'~/catkin_ws/data/snake/{run_id}')
27  logger = configure(log_dir, ["stdout", "csv", "log"])
28  model.set_logger(logger)
29 
30  # log model weights
31  freq = 300 # (time steps in a SINGLE environment)
32  callback = CheckpointCallback(save_freq=freq, save_path=log_dir)
33 
34  # run training
35  steps = 50000 # 50k (timesteps accross ALL environments)
36  print(f"training on {steps} steps")
37  model.learn(total_timesteps=steps, callback=callback)
38 
39  # save final weights
40  print("done training")
41  model.save(log_dir + "/final_weights")
42  env.close() # this must be done to clean up other processes
